body_html:
cupti is present in tensorflow/tensorflow:1.6.0-devel-gpu-py3. I think it makes sense.

In addition, in CUDA 9.0, CUPTI is not in its own package, so we would have to pull ~100MB of dependencies just to get CUPTI in the non-devel image.
I suggest that we either keep CUPTI out of the non-devel image, or we wait until cuda 9.1+ to add it back since it finally has a dedicated package (cuda-cupti-9-1).

@gunan

cupti is present in `tensorflow/tensorflow:1.6.0-devel-gpu-py3`. I think it makes sense.

In addition, in CUDA 9.0, CUPTI is not in its own package, so we would have to pull ~100MB of dependencies just to get CUPTI in the non-devel image.
I suggest that we either keep CUPTI out of the non-devel image, or we wait until cuda 9.1+ to add it back since it finally has a dedicated package (`cuda-cupti-9-1`).
